special_powers.description: When Sayd hits an opposing character, after actions resolve you may give that character a move action as a free action and as if it was a friendly character, using Improved Movement: Characters.

Ziilus Zox can use Blades/Claws/Fangs and Plasticity. When he rolls a d6 for Blades/Claws/Fangs, put a number of Bite tokens on this card equal to his printed damage value minus the result of the d6 roll (minimum 0). Give Zilius Zox a free action and remove two Bite tokens to make a close combat attack as a free action.
Zilius Zox can use Poison and deals penetrating damage when using it.
Adara can use Perplex, but only to increase combat values. Adara can use the Quintessence team ability.
This character can use Improved Targeting: Hindering.

special_powers.name: Power Battery
special_powers.description: Orange squares are Power Battery squares. The player who chose this map may choose to place a WOL #R100 Power Battery (Green Lantern Corps) that is already part of his or her force in the Power Battery squares, but only if its Emotional Spectrum trait is active. Once a Power Battery has been placed, no other player may place one. At the end of the Power Battery player's turn, roll a d6 and on a result of 5-6, you may remove 1 action token from a friendly Corps Member that currently has 2. NOT FOR TOURNAMENT PLAY.

special_powers.name: Plasma Pillars
special_powers.description: Orange squares are Plasma Pillar squares. During the beginning of your turn, any hindering or blocking terrain markers in Plasma Pillar squares are removed from the game and any character occupying a Plasma Pillar square is dealt 1 unavoidable damage for each action token they are currently assigned.

special_powers.name: Power Battery
special_powers.description: Orange squares are Power Battery squares. The player who chose this map may choose to place a WOL #R103 Power Battery (Orange Lantern Corps) that is already part of his or her force in the Power Battery squares, but only if its Emotional Spectrum trait is active. Once a Power Battery has been placed, no other player may place one. When a Corps Member friendly to the Power Battery uses Barrier, it may place up to an additional 2 blocking terrain markers. NOT FOR TOURNAMENT PLAY.

special_powers.name: Power Battery
special_powers.description: Orange squares are Power Battery squares. The player who chose this map may choose to place a WOL #R107 Power Battery (Blue Lantern Corps) that is already part of his or her force in the Power Battery squares, but only if its Emotional Spectrum trait is active. Once a Power Battery has been placed, no other player may place one. When a Corps Member friendly to the Power Battery uses Perplex to target a friendly character, it may use it a second time targeting the same character but a different combat value, neither of which can be damage. NOT FOR TOURNAMENT PLAY.

special_powers.name: Low Gravity
special_powers.description: All characters can use Improved Movement: Elevated

special_powers.name: Black Mercy
special_powers.description: Orange squares are Black Mercy squares and are treated as hindering terrain. Characters occupying Black Mercy squares modify their defense values by -3 when targeted by Incapacitate or Mind Control.

special_powers.name: Power Battery
special_powers.description: Orange squares are Power Battery squares. The player who chose this map may choose to place a WOL #R102 Power Battery (Red Lantern Corps) that is already part of his or her force in the Power Battery squares, but only if its Emotional Spectrum trait is active. Once a Power Battery has been placed, no other player may place one. When a Corps Member not on its starting click makes a close combat attack, modify its attack value by +1. NOT FOR TOURNAMENT PLAY.

special_powers.name: Power Battery
special_powers.description: Orange squares are Power Battery squares. The player who chose this map may choose to place a WOL #R105 Power Battery (Sinestro Corps) that is already part of his or her force in the Power Battery squares, but only if its Emotional Spectrum trait is active. Once a Power Battery has been placed, no other player may place one. Corps Members friendly to the Power Battery can use Shape Change, but only succeed on a result of 6. NOT FOR TOURNAMENT PLAY.

special_powers.name: Open Air (Solid Orange Line)
special_powers.description: Orange squares are Open Air squares. After actions resolve, if a character who can't use the Flight ability occupies an Open Air square, deal them 1 unavoidable damage, then that character's owner places them in their starting area. Non-held objects in Open Air squares are removed from the map.

special_powers.name: Power Battery (Dashed Orange Line)
special_powers.description: Orange squares are Power Battery squares. The player who chose this map may choose to place a WOL #R104 Power Battery (Indigo Tribe) that is already part of his or her force in the Power Battery squares, but only if its Emotional Spectrum trait is active. Once a Power Battery has been placed, no other player may place one. When a Corps Member friendly to the Power Battery uses Support, add 1 to the amount healed. NOT FOR TOURNAMENT PLAY.

special_powers.name: Power Battery
special_powers.description: Orange squares are Power Battery squares. The player who chose this map may choose to place a WOL #R106 Power Battery (Violet Lantern Corps) that is already part of his or her force in the Power Battery squares, but only if its Emotional Spectrum trait is active. Once a Power Battery has been placed, no other player may place one. When a Corps Member uses Shape Change, it may add 1 to the result of the d6 roll. NOT FOR TOURNAMENT PLAY.

special_powers.name: Power Battery
special_powers.description: Orange squares are Power Battery squares. The player who chose this map may choose to place a WOL #R108 Power Battery (Black Lantern Corps) that is already part of his or her force in the Power Battery squares, but only if its Emotional Spectrum trait is active. Once a Power Battery has been placed, no other player may place one. When a Corps Member friendly to the Power Battery KO's an opposing character, roll a d6 and subtract 2 (minimum 0): heal that many other Corps Members of 1 damage. NOT FOR TOURNAMENT PLAY.
